description: Adds a Datasource or a XA Datasource to an Application Server instance given by the inventory path stored in resourcePath field.

xaDatasource.description: true if an XA datasource should be added, false otherwise

jndiName.description: the JNDI name for the datasource

driverName.description: Name of the JDBC driver as available under /subsystem=datasources/jdbc-driver=* in WildFly configuration.

driverClass.description: The fully qualified name of the JDBC driver class. For non-XA Datasources either needs to be explicitly set here or in the JDBC driver referenced in driverName.

connectionUrl.description: The JDBC driver connection URL. Required for non-XA datasources.

xaDataSourceClass.description: The fully qualified name of the javax.sql.XADataSource implementation. For XA Datasources either needs to be explicitly set here or in the JDBC driver referenced in driverName.

datasourceProperties.description: Either a list of xa-datasource-properties in case this is a XA datasource or otherwise a list of connection-properties for a non-XA datasource.

userName.description: The user name used when creating a new connection.

password.description: The password used when creating a new connection.

securityDomain.description: The security domain which defines the javax.security.auth.Subject that are used to distinguish connections in the pool.
